title: What the papers say – January 22
description: Problems with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s pledge of free childcare catches the attention of The Times, which says it is in jeopardy due to delays in funding, staff shortages and IT problems. The Daily Telegraph focuses on the BBC and an article written ...

title: EVs could outpace new oil and gas licences in cutting fuel imports, analysts say

title: GP funding cut in real terms as appointment waits climb – Lib Dems
description: “The Conservative Party’s record on the NHS is one of total neglect and failure. Rishi Sunak is completely out of touch with patients struggling to get the care they need. “Being able to see your GP when you need to should be the very cornerstone of ...

title: UK at risk of becoming a ‘burnt-out nation’, mental health charity warns
description: Mental Health UK urged Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to hold a national summit to bring together ministers, employers and experts in a bid to create healthy workplaces and better support workers. Deidre Bowen, director of national programmes at Mental Health ...

title: Sunak’s Rwanda plan faces first test in Lords with bid to delay treaty
description: Rishi Sunak is bracing for a battle with the House of Lords over his controversial Rwanda deportation plan. The first test will come on Monday with a debate on a motion seeking to delay the Rwanda treaty. Many peers have already expressed deep unease about ...

title: Economy expected to grow by 0.9% in 2024 in major boost to Rishi Sunak's Government ahead of general election later this year
description: The economy will pick up this year in a major boost for Rishi Sunak ahead of the general election, a report suggests. The EY Item Club said it now expects output to rise by 0.9 per cent in 2024, having previously pencilled in growth of 0.7 per cent.

title: Rishi Sunak set to spend £36m a year on fleet of private vessels to stop migrant boats
description: Mr Sunak has pledged to replace Border Force vessels with new cutters to improve the safety of Britain's borders.

title: BBC to get tougher scrutiny amid bias concerns
description: Rishi Sunak has previously urged the corporation to describe Hamas as a terrorist group, saying in October: “This is not a time for equivocation, we should call it out for what it is.” ‘Not BBC’s job to say who bad guys are’ John Simpson ...

title: UK at risk of becoming a ‘burnt-out nation’, mental health charity warns
description: Mental Health UK urged Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to hold a national summit to bring together ministers, employers and experts in a bid to create healthy workplaces and better support workers. There will be no simple, one-size-fits-all solution ...

title: His Dark Materials author Philip Pullman pleads ministers to protect school libraries amid fears of reading crisis among children
description: He spoke out after War Horse writer Sir Michael Morpurgo wrote to Rishi Sunak and Sir Keir Starmer to demand funding for books. Sir Michael cited a survey that found 42 per cent of children under seven miss out on a bedtime story.
